title: Grade 6
subject: English Language Arts - Extended Learning Standards (2019-)

document.title: Ohio’s Learning Standards – Extended with Learning Progressions English Language Arts

A6910D67B83C4CD9BF2AC178BC00B8B1.description:
Actively engage in the reading of various content-area
texts.

17962F19A54244F4885E14946C6FA7E5.description:
Choose appropriate domain-specific words from a word
bank for writing or speaking during a learning activity.

81454BECCE5B4A1E941CAA218579522D.description:
Communicate
using grade-level
words and phrases
acquired through
interactions with
others.

120BAD718A5846788AFCEC19F73138DB.description:

academic and
content-specific
words and phrases in
conversations.

992336B326424B8490DF5C38775412DD.description:

grade-level,
age-appropriate
academic and
content-specific
words and phrases
in speaking and
writing.

accurately grade-appropriate
general academic and
domain-specific words and
phrases; gather vocabulary
knowledge when considering
a word or phrase important to
comprehension or expression.

07568495A9A04B6FA84024B0FF42CB2A.description: Communicate by connecting words to convey meaning.

F4144E22D68C41B9B8BB4079C9BF5EF0.description:

the word “rock” as a noun vs. a verb)

52F72A0957F741C690313CD8FCE510C4.description: Match words with their literal and alternate meanings.

3DC241297C5C462095B2D48FF82C04BB.description:
Match words that are related in some way (e.g., cause/
effect, part/whole, item/category)

C523227BE804419C9F1B8465133C94B6.description: Identify when a word or phrase is being used in a nonliteral way. (figure of speech, idiom)

85320C34A1784D1590DB1AF7A6DAE90E.description:
Demonstrates a foundation in denotation (dictionary
definition) and connotation (alternate meanings based on
feelings associated with a word).

E11CD71A2A6B4D478F7C36B8F06B8941.description:
Identify
connections
between words
and their uses.

AAD5E7BD3FE947F4B2CCAE3666EC400C.description:
Identify the
relationship between
words and phrases
such part-whole,
cause/effect.

E8DC6DD51AE346CCB61FA25C06999968.description:
Explain the
meaning of figures
of speech; explain
the different
connotations of
words that address
a similar concept
(e.g., irritated vs.
angry).

630C7A6239DF446E93283B58BF4FFB18.description:
Demonstrate
understanding of figurative
language, word relationships,
and nuances in word
meanings.
a. Interpret figures of speech
(e.g., personification) in
context.
b. Use the relationship
between particular words
(e.g., cause/effect, part/
whole, item/category) to
better understand each of
the words.
c. Distinguish among the
connotations (associations)
of words with similar
denotations (definitions)
(e.g., stingy, scrimping,
economical, frugal, thrifty).

F580366312774E548FF91150ABBEB52A.description:
Actively engage with objects, tactile, graphics, or other
sensory experiences to better understand the meaning of
words.

99952A97EE014127AB9FB713B0980C86.description:

have various meanings.

2ABC39430DB94EC4B891E1FB600495F2.description:
Recognize that words can be broken down into smaller
parts called roots and affixes.

3648B05D3E7D4373958F8858DE88363A.description:
Determine which connotation is appropriate to use in a
sentence base on the context.

3639DB1A27364F6BB97B42D3E55815DF.description: Label the parts of a dictionary definition.

EB8AC820C2D844089484758C2AAEA0B6.description:

words.

5713E2E97E5E4A3AB8340454BD91574C.description: Match affixes to appropriate roots to form words.

4344BDC3F90647A0AD44D95F71903D3B.description:

(dictionary definition).

77C2F03F059F4BE89D5C6E1276D4050A.description:
Connect the meaning of a word to its sentence or
paragraph level context.

15E4E6CCCEF142D9A57FC8FB56D5656C.description: Connect a word or picture to its correct meaning.

E73153405FB14EB0A8D54156A10E2778.description:

the meaning of
a word using
context clues,
including graphics
and/or word root
and common
morphemes.

6BC2051633684E62BE54D3A3CEA75112.description:
Use sentence
or paragraph-level
context to determine
the meaning of a word
in a particular context;
apply understanding
of common affixes
(e.g., un , re-, -ed,
-es, ing) to determine
word meaning.

844F5779386347178A4B970E72B51DCD.description:
Use
context clues,
word structure, or
reference materials
to determine
the meaning of
unfamiliar words or
phrases.

40F7AF38AF3747458EFAFE9BF71F0568.description:
Determine or clarify
the meaning of unknown and
multiple-meaning words and
phrases based on grade 6
reading and content, choosing
flexibly from a range of
strategies.
a. Use context (e.g., the overall
meaning of a sentence or
paragraph; a word’s position
or function in a sentence) as a
clue to the meaning of a word
or phrase.
b.Use common, gradeappropriate Greek or Latin
affixes and roots as clues to
the meaning of a word (e.g.,
audience, auditory, audible).
c. Consult reference materials
(e.g., dictionaries, glossaries,
thesauruses), both print and
digital, to find the pronunciation
of a word or determine or
clarify its precise meaning or
part of speech.
d.Verify the preliminary
determination of the meaning
of a word or phrase (e.g., by
checking the inferred meaning
in context or in a dictionary).

01785551C11A44ABBC0C0597E3565919.description:
Actively engage (through any mode of communication) in
a conversation with one participant.

90C9C3DAAB9947E1BB6FD4645A35F5C7.description:

emphasis.

3CEF1781CDCB4195A2E12B4AC4E51638.description:

C594000A3EF843FC99E1F99E877BDA2F.description:

a message that
expresses a
complete thought
(e.g., wants and
needs in student’s

communication).

of sentence patterns
when speaking or
writing.

Use
a variety of
sentence patterns
when speaking
or writing; be
consistent in
the style of
speaking or writing
throughout the

composition.

57AD60C64C664AAC8440F35F4380682B.description:
Use knowledge of
language and its conventions
when writing, speaking,
reading, or listening.
a.Vary sentence patterns for
meaning, reader/ listener
interest, and style.
b.Maintain consistency in
style and tone.

184FB7C3E775453498D5E4C61C40EEC8.description:

7551DAA6F76344D787C3EC337AA0C53E.description:
Identify
capital letters for

at the beginning

Demonstrate command

Communicate
using gestures,
pictures, phrases,
or other tools.

of standard English

Nouns, pronouns

the conventions
of grammar

speaking, including

Demonstrate command
of the conventions of standard
English grammar and usage

a. Ensure that pronouns are in

b. Use intensive pronouns
(e.g., myself, ourselves).
c. Recognize and correct
inappropriate shifts in
pronoun number and
person.
d. Recognize and correct
vague pronouns (i.e., ones
with unclear or ambiguous
antecedents).

standard English in their
own and others’ writing and
speaking, and identify and
use strategies to improve
expression in conventional
language.

peers.

information in a

the main points

102A5C18406A4923BBF13C7BD21370D4.description:
Interpret information

692C2E8D278A4B3E9ACBB716ACA5B609.description:

4407F6DD0E784F4DBB1FF4ADB23793A0.description: Distinguish key ideas from irrelevant ideas within a text.

Employ active listening skills (e.g., paraphrase points
made by the speaker, verbalize understanding of the
speaker’s point, etc.)

B268E1FE647B4A0AB6B9796F78E19AF4.description:
Demonstrate body language that indicates disagreement
with an idea.

73E5FEA253A543DE95C85598E9982AEF.description:
Actively
listen to one
other person
and respond to
questions (use
body language

14ED1D2CEA324EE5BB7FC3C8BFB1F26D.description:

D2E44D7BFEEF4A52AA9AF55ADC802F6C.description:

one idea.

E3B01F77DD304E98841693B40B14F335.description:
Engage effectively
in a range of collaborative
discussions (one-on-one, in

a. Come to discussions prepared,

material; explicitly draw on
that preparation by referring to

b. Follow rules for collegial
discussions, set specific goals
and deadlines, and define
individual roles as needed.
c. Pose and respond to specific
questions with elaboration and
detail by making comments
that contribute to the topic, text,
or issue under discussion.
d. Review the key ideas
expressed and demonstrate
understanding of multiple
perspectives through reflection
and paraphrasing.

DBB13A73841A4AC194E46ED344EACF07.description:

age-appropriate writing activities

needed.

progression in Reading
Foundations)
